contentrichtext.text: {{accounting}} In [[accountancy|accounting]] and finance, '''[[earnings]] before interest and taxes''' ('''EBIT'''), also called '''operating profit''' or '''operating income''' is a measure of a firm's [[profit (accounting)|profit]] that excludes interest and income tax expenses.<ref name=BrodieKaneMarcusEsstentials452>Bodie, Z., Kane, A. and Marcus, A. J. ''Essentials of Investments'', McGraw Hill Irwin, 2004, p. 452. ISBN 0-07-251077-3</ref> It is the difference between operating revenues and operating expenses. When a firm does not have [[non-operating income]], then '''operating income''' is sometimes used as a synonym for '''EBIT''' and [[Profit (accounting)|operating profit]].<ref>http://www.investorwords.com/3460/operating_income.html Operating income definition</ref> EBIT = [[Revenue]] – [[Operating expense]]s (OPEX) + [[Non-operating income]] Operating income = Revenue – Operating expenses<ref name=BrodieKaneMarcusEsstentials452/> A professional investor contemplating a change to the [[capital structure]] of a firm (e.g., through a [[leveraged buyout]]) first evaluates a firm's fundamental earnings potential (reflected by Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization [[EBITDA]] and EBIT), and then determines the optimal use of debt vs. equity. To calculate EBIT, expenses (e.g., the [[cost of goods sold]], selling and administrative expenses) are subtracted from revenues.<ref>http://www.investorwords.com/1631/EBIT.html EBIT definition</ref> [[Net income|Profit]] is later obtained by subtracting interest and taxes from the result. {| class="wikitable" |- | colspan="2" align="center"|'''Statement of Income — Example'''<br />''(figures in thousands)'' |- | colspan="2"|'''Revenue''' |- |      Sales Revenue | align="right"|$20,438 |- | colspan="2"|'''Operating Expenses''' |- |      Cost of goods sold | align="right"|$7,943 |- |      Selling, general and administrative expenses | align="right"|$8,172 |- |      [[Depreciation]] and [[amortization]] | align="right"|$960 |- |      Other expenses | align="right"|$138 |- |          Total operating expenses | align="right"|$17,213 |- | '''Operating income''' | align="right"|'''$3,225''' |- |      Non-operating income | align="right"|$130 |- | bgcolor="yellow"|'''Earnings before Interest and Taxes (EBIT)''' | align="right" bgcolor="yellow"|'''$3,355''' |- |      Financial income | align="right"|$45 |- | '''Income before Interest Expense (IBIE)''' | align="right"|'''$3,400''' |- |      Financial expense | align="right"|$190 |- | '''Earnings before income taxes''' | align="right"|'''$3,210''' |- |      [[Income tax]]es | align="right"|$1,027 |- | '''Net Income''' | align="right"|$2,183 |} (Table info source: Bodie, Z., Kane, A. and Marcus, A.
